intro: Lepidium coronopifolium, commonly known as the crown-leafed cress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky habitats and has small, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are white or pale yellow and are arranged in clusters, while its fruits are small, round pods that contain several seeds. Lepidium coronopifolium is often found in alpine or subalpine regions, where it thrives in cool, temperate climates.
